RESOLVED_ENTITIES.1996 Mercury Cougar: 1996 Mercury Cougar vehicle used for alien smuggling

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cocaine: illicit substance discovered during an immigration stop on Interstate 35, subject of suppression motions and appeals in Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso's case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: party in the appeal, responsible for filing notice of appeal within specified deadlines, considered evidence during bench trial of Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: court hearing the appeal, bound by the law of the case doctrine, interprets Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b) in determining jurisdiction and timeliness of appeals, lacks jurisdiction to review suppression decision due to untimely appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.defendant Smith: indicted suspect in an arson case, joined United States of America on the motion to subpoena footage, party meant to be protected by the timing requirements of Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b), suffered no harm from the United States of America's non-compliance with the precise letter of the law
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: defendant in a criminal case involving cocaine discovered during an immigration stop, argued against the United States of America's right to appeal the judgment for acquittal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.illegal aliens: individuals being smuggled into certain cities using disposable vehicles like 1996 Mercury Cougar
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.aliens: persons being smuggled into the United States, often hidden in cars with large trunks and voids in quarter panels
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.1996 Mercury Cougar vehicle used for ali: vehicle model frequently used for smuggling aliens due to its large trunk and void in quarter panels, found with cocaine hidden in the side panel during a stop at the U.S. Border Patrol Checkpoint on Interstate 35 near Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso's 1996 Mercury Co: specific vehicle used by Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso, suspected of being used for alien smuggling, found with cocaine hidden in the side panel during a stop at the U.S. Border Patrol Checkpoint on Interstate 35 near Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court issuing decisions subject to appeal within 30 days as required by Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b), has authority to extend time to file notice of appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b): statute governing the timing of appeals, allows for a 30-day additional period under certain conditions, includes materiality requirement and provisions for excusable neglect or good cause
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.case of Smith: arson case where defendant Smith was involved in a motion to subpoena footage
